characters: WE ARE HAVING A HOUSE MEETING,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Guillermo, a human, standing in an old-fashioned bedroom next to a coffin. He checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: (softly) It’s nightfall. A muffled foreign accent comes from the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR, (O.S)
dialogues.text: Guillermo?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Yes, Master. The coffin lid moves. It’s jammed.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s stuck again. Guillermo goes to assist. NANDOR (O.S.) (CONT’D) I think it’s the latch!

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The job of a vampire’s familiar is not an easy one.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: It’s jammed! Guillermo jiggles the lid of the coffin. It won’t open.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: A vampire’s familiar is kind of like a best friend... who’s also a slave, kind of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffin lid still won’t open. Guillermo is trying to jimmy latch with a butter knife.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: WWDITS USA v23 Ocotber 8, 2017 2. You’re not trying to pry it are you? Don’t pry it. You’1l foul the mechanism. Guillermo quickly stops prying and puts the butter knife his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night marks the 20th anniversary of when I started working for my master and I’m pretty sure he’s planning something special for me. I think tomorrow will be when he makes me a vampire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The latch has finally come open.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: He awakens! NANDOR elegantly arises from his coffin. Guillermo does a double thumbs up. GUILLERMO (CONT’D) Very cool, master. Super scary. Nandor stays grinning revealing that he has vampire fangs

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Awaken the others...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: (reluctantly) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: OPENING CREDITS
dialogues.text: We see images of our vampires throughout history. Coffins Fangs. The mediums they are depicted show a centuries-lon passage of time. Medieval woodcuts, tapestries, oil paintings, encyclopedia photos of statues, cubist paintings, silent film footage, photos from the late 1800 1920s, 1960s, 1980s, VHS footage, digital photos from the early 2000s. Every few images, there’s a quick pop of something frighteningly grotesque -- less artistic or cultural vampire depiction, and with more of a crime-scen photo feel. This is all to the song You’re Dead by Norma Tanega.  WWDITS December 8, 2017 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, severely dilapidated mansion subtly stands out i quiet suburb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a small library, within the vampire house.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: No, we’re going to have a house meeting!

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Didn’t we just have a house- meeting in 1981?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: That was in 1891, Lazslo.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Oh, hell!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: We’re doing it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interspersed with this seated interview, we see images of Nandor in various battles, in armor and different garbs.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: I have a reputation for being a very tough kind of vampire. Oil painting of Nandor in Ottoman clothing. As he speaks see illustrations of Nandor in battle. NANDOR (CONT’D) I used to be a very ferocious soldier in the Ottoman Empire. Which meant a lot of killing, a lot of pillaging. They’d say have mercy! Stop pillaging me! No, I’m pillaging everyone! You included! I was relentless. They called me “Nandor the Relentless”. Because I just never relent.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 4.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: All right!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: All right! Just think of it asa fun way of catching up with each other.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: This is worse than dying.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry you feel that way, Nadja. NANDOR (O.S. FROM INTERVIEW) (CONT’D) Co-habitating with other vampires makes sense for financial reasons. A lot of vampires spend a lot of money on castles and fancy capes then two hundred years later they’re like - uh oh, now I’m in an apartment wearing jeans.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Begin. Say your boring words. NANDOR That doesn’t fill me with confidence Nadja, but okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks like a Gothic queen wearing a HUGE ELIZABETHAN COLLAR.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It is nice staying in a house with other vampires. The only people I would speak to when I was in my castle would be my “victims”, which was sad. Because I ate them. Because we had some nice conversations.  WWDITS December 8, 2017

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Before I get to the important business at hand, a little housekeeping. We need to discuss general tidiness. Especially in the cell.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Which cell?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: The prison-y cell! Last night I heard all this shouting coming from there and there were so many angry people down there, half- drunk!

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: They had alcohol?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: No, they had only been half drunk. Drink the whole victim before you start another new one, please. There were nine people down there, still kinda alive, all moaning and complaining. Help me... Help me...

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: So gross.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: It is gross. One guy said he’d had five birthdays while he’s down in there.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Poor guy.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: I made him some birthday cards.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Should have just killed him.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: And then I killed him.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Oh, then what’s the problem?  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 6. They hiss at each other, their eyes now glowing red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazslo has an even larger ELIZABETHAN COLLAR than Nadja.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: This “house-meeting” - as he calls it -- seems like just another foul New World innovation Nandor is trying to foist upon us. I do not like it, sir. We see footage of Lazslo writing in a dusty tome with a q pen -- by the light of a single candle. And squinting har do so. In the background, Nandor switches on a table lamp Lazslo glares at him, and Nandor switches the lamp off an backs away apologetically. And Lazslo goes back to squint very hard to read by candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: I suppose I’m kind of a renaissance man in that I was born in 1531. I was the most handsome man in my village-- 16th Century painting of Lazslo looking the opposite of t

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: His village was badly affected by leprosy and the plague.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (proudly) It’s true. We see old drawings and paintings that illustrate Lazslo’ story.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: One night I was asleep and I heard a rrrrreeeep.... rrrrreeeppp... rrrreeeeppp at my window and I thought, “who’s this at my window? This is weird” -- because I was on the third floor and there was a very beautiful woman outside just floating there. I saw her and I was just absolutely hypnotized.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: I used hypnosis on him.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: WWDITS December 8, 2017 7. I invited her into my bedroom. She turned into this hideous bat creature, I thought, “this one’s different”. She drained my blood. Cursed me with the gift of eternal life, making me a thirsty creature of the shadows. We see them in more prosperous times and through the ages Eastern European rulers in fine garb. LAZSLO (CONT’D) Isn’t she intoxicating? My Nadja, Queen of the night. Nadja stares, completely bored.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: We all get along great and the house meetings will help us keep the lines of communication open and working together as a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandor and Lazslo FLY AT EACH OTHER, FANGS BARED. Lazslo swipes at Nandor’s face. Nadja calmly watches.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: It’s about hygiene, Lazslo!

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: It’s about your ego, Nandor!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Hissssss!

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Hecccccccchhh!

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Why don’t we start writing our names and dates on the victims with marker pen! Suddenly Nandor and Lazslo are normal sliding back into t chairs like nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: Great suggestion.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 8.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Good idea, Nadja. Marker pens, Guillermo! And now we come to the real purpose of this house meeting. (takes an ominous beat) Guillermo, close the door.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: It is closed.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Close it more. Confused, Guillermo pushes on the door as Nandor takes ou fancy envelope - sealed with a wax signet and covered in foreign stamps. NANDOR (CONT’D) We have received a letter from The Baron. Nadja, Lazslo, and Guillermo react. This is a very seriou development. NANDOR (CONT’D) As we are all now -- finally -- gathered as one, in compliance with the protocols, I will impart The Baron’s message. Nandor opens the letter. What he reads stuns him. NANDOR (CONT’D) The Baron... is coming to visit us. A dramatic pause of disbelief. Interrupted by...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: (softly) Holy crap.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Silence, Guillermo. Vampire comments only. Guillermo nods.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: The Baron’s never left the Old Country before. Does he say what is the purpose of his visit?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: When does the great one arrive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo December 8, 2017 9.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (skimming letter) Um... Guillermo... figure this out?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: (reading) Tomorrow. seems quietly upset. So does Nandor.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you give this to me earlier?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: It just arrived this morning. Nandor angrily shoos Guillermo away with the letter.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (grandly) Let it never be said that The Baron does not know how to make an entrance that will shock and astonish! It’s obvious that Lazslo worships The Baron, while Nandor less impressed -- and even a bit jealous of The Baron. Guillermo reference.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. We’re all shocked and astonished that The Baron has not yet discovered Federal Express. laughs, but Nadja and Lazslo don’t get the

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Federal what?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: You know -- Fed Ex. “When It Absolutely, Positively Has To Be There Overnight.” Fed Ex. I’m not sure what it is.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (suspicious) Have you been secretly viewing a television box again?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (covering) No. Of course not. It’s just contemporary folk tale Guillermo told me about. Regardless, there is much work to  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 10. INT. be done. And precious little time to do it.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: The Baron is great. As great as his own legend? (shrugs) Not for me to say. Nandor shakes his head to say “No.”

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (makes sure no one is listening) My suspicion is that The Baron has gotten wind of how Nandor has been running things over here. Straying too often from the old ways. So this should be interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadja is speaking quietly, so as not to be overheard. INT.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: I’m nervous about seeing The Baron with Lazslo present. The Baron and I enjoyed a very long, very intense sexual affair a few hundred years ago. Very physical, very animal. A lot of acrobatic stuff. It could be awkward.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Many bloodlines flow back to The Baron! The powers that flow through our veins are rumored to be an eternal gift from The Baron himself. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat, then quietly) Also, a while back, The Baron and I enjoyed a very long, very intense sex affair. Very animal. Some pretty  WWDITS December 8, 2017 11. acrobatic stuff. It will be good to reconnect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadja rejoins Nandor, Lazslo, and Guillermo, who are gathered around the table. Nandor is looking at the plann notes he’s written on an eighty-year old yellow legal pad

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: So... Guillermo will transport The Baron from his point of debarkation to here--

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: On a velvet-lined caisson drawn by four black horses!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Yeahhhhh... I know that’s the tradition, but let’s be realistic. So perhaps just two black horses? Guillermo? Do-able?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Not on such short notice, Master. They all sit and think.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: A dark camel?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Maybe a taxi?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: A black taxi. Lazslo nods his head.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Okay, great. Now, as for The Baron’s bloodfeast...

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: We should get a couple of virgins.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: Lovely!  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 12.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Guillermo, two virgins by tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Of course, master.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: We shall feast on virgin blood! The vampires laugh. Guillermo does his best to join in.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Vampire-only laughing. Guillermo hangs his head.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Are we inviting Colin as well?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: That would ruin the evening. A very ordinary looking man, mopey even, stands at the

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: What’s ruining the evening?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (to Guillermo) I knew you didn’t close the door.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Are we having another house meeting?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Hello, my name is Colin Robinson and I’m what’s called a psychic vampire or “energy vampire”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin has someone trapped in a corner of an office.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Energy vampires drain people’s energy merely by talking to them. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: doorway.  WWDITS December 8, 2017 13.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In fact you probably know an energy vampire. We’re the most common kind of vampire. Colin’s office mate loses color before our eyes. Colin lo energized. His eyes glow for a brief moment. COLIN ROBINSON I just drained Joan’s energy just by having a long chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN ROBINSON It’s actually cooler to be an energy vampire. We are “daywalkers”, we’re not harmed by the sun. We don’t need to drink blood and we’re the only vampires that can suck energy from other vampires!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: So, we’re not having a house meeting? The other vampires, their energy drained, just shake thei heads. COLIN ROBINSON (CONT’D) Oh. Colin lingers creepily, and leaves the room way too slowl

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Phew.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (exhausted) His power grows stronger every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazslo and Nadja in matching outfits are out for a walk.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: We left Europe about two hundred years ago because there was a lot  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 14. of prejudice against vampires in Europe at that time. Era-appropriate illustration of people with flaming torch And a brief flash of a decapitated vampire head on a pike

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: They didn’t like the color of our skin.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Or how we killed and ate people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NADJA (V.O.) We must be careful when walking amongst the living so we do our best to blend in. Nadja and Lazslo do not blend in. They look like the most intense goth couple you’ve ever seen. They eye human prey

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: They look nice.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: No, he looks fatty and drunk.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. We must seem as mortals lest we be driven from this land as well. A couple of COLLEGE BROS walk over the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BRO 1
dialogues.text: Go back to your own country!

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: We’ve been here since 1862, fatty! The College Bros look confused. Lazslo waves his hands hypnotically. LAZSLO (CONT’D) I mean... our family has... fatty. The College Bros lose all memory of the interaction they’ just had and walk onward. Watching them go...

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: WWDITS December 8, 2017 15. It’s getting early. Let’s just make an apertif of these two and save our appetites for the virgins tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Fine. But you get the fatty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The College Bros walk in the park. Lazslo and Nadja are n magically in front of them. The Bros pause... turn the ot way, the camera follows them. Out of nowhere Nadja and La now magically block them from the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: COLLEGE BRO
dialogues.text: Ahhhhh! Nadja and Lazslo fly at them and pull the into the air. Geysers of blood, horrific screams, and the crunch of chomped cartilage. Then silence. A blood-soaked red baseball cap lies in the gutter, while Nadja and Lazslo w blood from their faces.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Not bad! And now, shall we explore each other’s bodies in a frenzy of carnal passion, yes?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: All right, but not here, by the public toilet. And you got some on your face.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Oh. From the front we see half of Lazslo’s face is completely covered in blood. LAZSLO (CONT’D) Is it gone? He ineffectually wipes his face but it’s still very blood

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Still some there.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: I’1l1 fly home and wash... and prepare for lovemaking. Nadja has seen something in the distance.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 16.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: (distracted) Yeah, okay. I’m going to walk.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Well, you know how I feel about walking. If I can turn into a bat, I won’t do it! BAT! Lazslo clicks his thumbs and turns into a bat, flies, cra into a pole, corrects himself and successfully flies away Nadja peers from behind a tree at a A MAN sitting on a be reading from his phone.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: (to herself) Can it be? THE MAN gets up and walks away. Nadja glides silently beh him. INT. NANDOR’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Guillermo is helping Nandor out of his ornate waking-hour vestments, and hanging them carefully on a museum-quality tailor’s dummy.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Careful with my vestments, Guillermo! A light touch is crucial...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: I know, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: The gold in that brocade came from the personal--

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO NANDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...the personal treasury of ...the personal treasury of V The Impaler, I know. Vlad The Impaler himself! NANDOR (CONT’D) The Baron will probably still be on Old World time, so his slumber cycle might be all messed-up.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: WWDITS December 8, 2017 17. We don’t want him waking up in day time and being barbecue meats.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In some ways I’m disappointed that The Baron is arriving on my anniversary of being a familiar but how often do you get to see an ancient vampire? Along with Guillermo’s interview we see him perform tasks Sometimes with Nandor. Opening curtains, sweeping, washin out blood-stains, hanging Nandor’s vestments carefully on tailor’s dummy, adjusting the antennas on the tiny 1970s television that Nandor does indeed secretly watch, boardi up windows.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: And also, block all of the upstairs windows. Huge sunlight risk. Back to the interview.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: When I saw Antonio Banderas as ‘Armand’ in Interview with a Vampire. 1994. I was blown away. He was the first Hispanic vampire I was exposed to and it was then I decided I wanted to be a vampire. We see Guillermo in a photo from 20 years ago in an illfitting vampire costume. He makes an unconvincing Anto Banderas but we know what he is going for.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MANSION. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Guillermo opens the door for Nandor.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: It seems an eternity since I ventured out of doors. How long has it been, Guillermo?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Not since I’ve known you. Nandor floats out the front door. Guillermo closes it.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 18. Guillermo

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: My cape is caught in the door! Guillermo, can you free my cape? Maybe I should just wear my short cape. fusses with the door. NANDOR (CONT’D) Is the brocade okay? How’s the brocade looking?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Intricate and undamaged, Master.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Good. Now, take me to the nearest purveyor of decorative supplies for revelry and debauchery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandor is examining a roll of black crepe paper from the shelf -- fascinated -- having never seen such a thing before.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: So deliciously macabre. What is it called again?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Crepe paper.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Exquisite. Also, get me some of that colorful dust that sparkles.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Glitter?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Yes. Get me some... “glitter”. Every color.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: What for, master?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: I want to do something special for The Baron’s arrival so I’m going to sprinkle some on my face and my body. Very... (sotto) Twilight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December 8, 2017 19.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Ugh. Wow. But okay. What’s the crepe paper for?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: For The Baron’s bloodfeast. (explaining) In the Old Country, we’d weave a canopy out of the flayed human skin. But I think that’s because we didn’t have crepe paper.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: You want I should ask up front if they have anything that looks more like the flayed skin?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: No, Guillermo. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Guillermo is my familiar but sometimes he’s a lil too “familiar”, know what I mean? He’s always hanging around me. He works hard but, he’s not great at it. I don’t like to say this kind of thing in front of him, of course. WIDEN TO REVEAL: Guillermo is actually sitting right next Nandor. NANDOR (CONT’D) Sorry Guillermo. I didn’t like saying that in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: That’s okay, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Can you see how he’s just always around me? Look at him.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo peruses the store. He sees something. He approa

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Master. Check it out. So macabre! Guillermo holds up one of those cardboard skeleton decorations one uses for kids’ birthday parties. Nandor s wearily then waves his hand -- and the cardboard skeleton cutout bursts into flames in Guillermo’s hands. Guillermo drops it and stamps it out. Guillermo walks away crestfal

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: And that’1ll be 79.85. Cash or credit?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Credit card.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: You can’t pay with that, throw him a metal coin. Nandor throws a coin at the store owner.

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: That’s 25 cents sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Enjoy it!

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: It’s not enough.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Stab this man.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Just credit card.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: You kind of disobeyed me just now. And I’m noting it. It’s because I didn’t like the skeleton, isn’t it. Nandor..  WWDITS December 8, 2017 21. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see from a long lens Nadja floating outside of the win of the Man from the park. The Man flops onto his bed. Kic off one shoe. Half pulls down his pants. It’s a sad sight

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: It’s him. The Man clumsily turns off his light. It’s dark now. Nadj tries to peer in. She sees nothing. Suddenly, his face is up by his phone screen. By his expression he seems to be masturbating. Nadja holds up a 1940s flash bulb camera an takes a photo with the bright flash. Suddenly the lamp tu on... the Man runs to the window holding his pants up. No is there. The Man looks through his now open window. A tr can falls over. He puts his head out. The window comes do and nearly takes off his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overburdened with decorations, Guillermo tries to bring u his anniversary.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Can you tell me about when you became a vampire, Master? How long did you wait?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Not that long. Hey, any progress on those virgins yet?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: I know an awesome place to find virgins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest Live Action Role-Play group are dressed in their idea of fantasy clothes - e.g. Someone might wear a feathered hat, a cape and Fila shoes. The uncoolest thing you have ever seen. The LARP group playing out a scene. Larper Girl throws some dice.

dialogues.speaker: LARP GIRL
dialogues.text: Nine - Confrontation!

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: This ale is poisoned, peasant!  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 22.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: How dare you make that false accusation sir! I have poisoned not your ale, wench! The other Larpers mock outrage at the language.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Didst thou callest me wench, troll? Guillermo speaks quietly to cam. GUILLERMO (T.C.) These Live Action Role-Playing groups have a very high ratio of adult virgins. It’s harder to find someone who isn’t a virgin here. ANGLE ON: Jonathan and Larper 2 are gingerly fighting wit wooden swords. The other LARPERS ARE AMUSED. They laugh a cheer. GUILLERMO (T.C) (CONT’D) Look at them dressed as elves or some shit.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: In the old country, centuries ago, I was in a very passionate love with a human man called Gregor. He was a knight, he wore armor, he was very cool. He was decapitated in a battle and it was sad. But I never really got over Gregor. Even when I met Lazslo. Lazslo floats past the doorway, struggling with a boot. A older woman (Lazslo and Nadja’s silent familiar JUNE) fol him patiently, trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: You will go on my foot, boot! Nadja waits to make sure Lazslo is gone.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: The man I saw tonight -- I think it was him.  WWDITS December 8, 2017 23. We see a beautiful baroque painting of a man in armor recoiling from a sword with an anguished face. It certain seems to be the same man although a lot cooler. NADJA (CONT’D) I think he is the reincarnation of my ex-boyfriend, Gregor. We are now closer on the face of the painting. This is crossfaded with the photo Nadja took of the man caught masturbating. It’s the same face with the exact same expression. Back to Nadja looking concerned.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t foot rhyme with boot? Foot. Boot. Fooooot. Booooot. Ah! I did it! I’m going to write you a poem darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance Guillermo is showing Jonathan and Jenna photos on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Check this shit out.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Woah.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: We got swords, we got crossbows, we got all kinds of medieval shit. Come tomorrow night, 9pm. Don’t be early. Guillermo gives the thumbs up to the camera. Mouths “virgins”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandor is leading Nadja and Lazslo through a dark, dusty hallway.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: I’ve never been in this part of the house.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 24. Some bats

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: No one has for 80 years. I’ve preserved these chambers unsullied that we might have an appropriate location for a ceremonial bloodfeast, should The Baron ever visit. fly out a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: (to camera) Those are just some vampire buddies of mine.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: They are just normal bats.

dialogues.speaker: LAZLSO
dialogues.text: That’s Jeremy and Carol!

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: No vampire would be called Jeremy.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Another plus? If we have The Baron’s ceremony here, you-know-who won’t even need to know. I mean Colin. Nandor opens an old door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a normal, brightly lit bedroom. Colin’s in there.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Ever heard of knocking?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Colin? What are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: This is my bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: How can I help you?  WWDITS December 8, 2017 25.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: We are just saying hi. (pause) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: I’ve never had someone visit me before.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Okay, good to see you! Bye!

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Hey, what’s happening tomorrow night?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Not having virgins for dinner!! Colin looks disappointed. He knows. Nandor, Nadja, and La head back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (quietly) There’s another unsullied chamber down in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: The Baron is accustomed to the grandest blood-halls and abattoirs! Our junk room is not fit for him!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: We can move the Stairmaster out of there.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Good idea. Never understood its supposed use anyway.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: It’s said to improve fortitude and stamina.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Didn’t even work as a torture device. Just made our victims very skinny, very slowly.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo signs a bill of landing on a clipboard, as a la wooden crate is off-loading from a ship. An ancient, sile odd-looking man -- THE BARON’S FAMILIAR -- stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo supervises as THREE REGULAR GUYS unload the cra from a battered BLACK VAN that has MOISHE’S MOVERS on the side and carry it into the house. The Baron’s Familiar ke one hand reverently on the top of The Baron’s coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As The Baron’s Familiar looks on, Guillermo uses a crowba pry open the wooden crate, revealing a beautiful, ancient coffin with intricate carvings on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nadja talks about Gregor we see different versions of through history. Some with her alongside him.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Gregor was reincarnated again as a Persian street thief, he was caught and they beheaded him “to teach him a lesson” and it did stop him to be honest. Then many decades later he returned as a beautiful Slovenian washerman. We did manage to fool around a couple of times but apparently she got her head chopped off in a toilet cleaning accident, don’t ask me how. Weird. A lot of beheadings. I just noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadja stands in the long shadows of late dusk. Every part her body is covered, protectively, including a black hat a dark veil. But still, we can see that she is physically weakened, and has taken a great risk to come out before i completely dark. The Man leaves his building. As he passe

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Man? Human man? He doesn’t turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns. December 8, 2017 27. NADJA (CONT’D) Gregor! NADJA (CONT’D) It is you.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Gregor, the centuries have not changed you.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Oh. My name’s Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Jeff...

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh wait... I remember you.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: From a past life long ago.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Ah... From the park last night?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No, Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Gregor De’ Lavoir.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: No, Jeff Leibenstein. But... you know what’s weird?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: What is weird Gr.. Jeff Leibenstein?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: When I was in 12th grade I used to wish my name was Greg.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: As in Gregor.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 28.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: As in Greg.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nandor is lighting candles in a big candelabra.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Guillermo? Will the virgins be arriving soon?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Yes, Master. Fingers crossed.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Aaaaaarrrghhh! (then) Oh, it’s only a finger cross. Don’t do that. The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Dinner is served. Nandor and Lazslo roll their eyes at Guillermo’s attempt joke. Guillermo opens the door and welcomes in Jenna and Jonathan from the LARP group. GUILLERMO (CONT’D) Jenna. Jonathan. So pleased you could make it.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Well, this house is officially creepy.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Very authentic. Nandor and Lazslo eye Jenna and Jonathan skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Hi!!! Are you the two virgins?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I don’t see how that is any of your business.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: So, yes. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December 8, 2017 29.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: Well, my boyfriend and I haven’t met IRL.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: In real life.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: He’s fictional?

dialogues.speaker: JENNA
dialogues.text: No, we met online. We’re planning an IRL meet later in the year. F2F is a big step for us.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: What language is this?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I’m not a virgin. In my last relationship we did quote pretty much everything unquote...

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Except sex?

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: A gentleman mage doesn’t tell of his conquests sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Well done, Guillermo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff walks along and Nadja glides along beside him.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: I must go soon.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Right. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: I just came to beg of you: Avoid dangerous activities -- especially those involving the head and/or the neck.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 30.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah, I pretty much stick to just cardio and weights.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Uh huh. I simply couldn’t bear losing you. Again.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: So, are you a knight?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah! Well, a night watchman at a supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Protector of the people.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Oh, not really. Ha. Nadja laughs like Jeff is a hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: My sweet Gregor-Jeff! I’d forgotten what a brilliant raconteur you were! I must leave you now. But I will find you again!

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Okay, well if you want to get coffee...

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Oh, Gregor -- remember that time we made love so passionately that I accidentally cut your head off? And then I kept going till my needs were met? Let's do that again. But maybe without the knifeplay.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Do what now? She’s gone. JEFF (CONT’D) Weird.  WWDITS December 8, 2017 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo is leading Jenna and Jonathan down a basement hallway.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: So the party is going to start in a little while. Why don’t you guys just have a seat in here and I’11l come get you when-- Guillermo opens the door to a room. There are people with writing on their heads. E.g. Nadja - September 15 2016 Lazslo June 2010? They’re milling about -- gruesome, halfdead lost souls. One of them is strapped to a wall, moaning. GUILLERMO (CONT’D) Oops. Why don’t we wait up in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which looks very subterranean and spooky. Candelabras and torches. (But there’s still an old StairMaster in the bac that looks too heavy to move, which has been covered in black crepe paper.) Guillermo has propped The Baron’s cof up at the head of the table, but it’s still sealed shut. Baron’s Familiar stands at attention just behind the Baro coffin. Nandor and Lazslo are sitting at the coffin’s rig and left. Nadja and Lazslo’s silent familiar JUNE stands nearby. A bat flutters in, then transforms into Nadja, wh takes a seat at the table.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Boy, are my arms tired.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: You're late!

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (formally) We three are gathered as one, as the protocols dictate. So the ceremony can commence. Guillermo? Can you open The Baron’s caske-- But before Nandor can finish speaking, The Baron’s casket slowly opens with the sound of heavy wood or stone creaki Its contents are enveloped in a heavy mist, from which emerges... A truly scary vampire. Long fangs, drawn face, wispy hair pale skin.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 32. It is naked, has no genitals and has wing-like flaps of s under its armpits. Even Nandor, Nadja, and Lazslo seem frightened of its form. It begins speaking, in a horrifyi ancient Latin tongue, which sounds like a backwards-talki person from Twin Peaks with the voice of Bane.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: Ne la materia che mai non dorme re de I fenomeni re de le forme--

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: My Sire? If I may? That we might comprehend you more clearly? English please.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: The old tongue has withered with us, like nightshade in a desert.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: I totally remember him as having genitals.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: (still horrifying voice timbre) Does this suit you better?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: My Sire? Just so as not to frighten our familiars? Perhaps a form that could pass for human? ANGLE ON: Guillermo and June, both in shock at The Baron’ form. Despite their familiarity with the supernatural, they’re both paralyzed with fear and have tears trickling down their cheeks. Another flash of light and smoke, and Baron transmogrifies into into a slightly less-scary form large half-man, half-bat, whose breath forms a mist as if his mere presence has reduced the room’s temperature to s zero.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: How’s this?

dialogues.speaker: NADJA/LAZSLO/NANDOR
dialogues.text: Perfect./I liked the first way./Still a bit scary.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Guillermo? Fetch the virgins. Guillermo exits hastily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: December 8, 2017 33. I am weary from my journey.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Before you start, Sire, I’d just like to go on record as saying that the old ways are the best ways. And for too long we here may have been led astray by the allure of the new.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Inaccurate and unfair.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: You’ll notice “crepe” paper instead of actual human skin.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Kind of a dick move to bring this up at this particular juncture, Lazslo.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: (so loud it shakes plaster off the ceiling and extinguishes some of the candles) SILENCE. I have come with a message. The Baron now has their full attention. Nandor, THE BARON (CONT’D) The Old World is dead. The Old Ways are over. The New World -- this “aAmrika” as you call it -- is our lifeline to an eternal future.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Say what now?

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: Have you forgotten why I sent you three here in the first place? Nadja, and Lazslo all think -- but they obviously have forgotten. THE BARON (CONT’D) The mission.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: (to interview camera) I don’t know what he’s talking about, mission. I came here by mistake.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 34.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: You were supposed to conquer the New World! Two hundred years have passed with no progress! And here you be: the land of opportunity spread before you like a blood banquet. And yet you hide in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: We go out...

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: ...instead of engaging with this wonderful New World -- a land that virtually thirsts for a new order of masters and supplicants.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: A fair point. But on the other hand-

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: Your idleness and sloth have left you mired in irrelevance. But no longer! The Great Plan recommences now! And the world will not soon forget this hallowed night when a decree went forth. The human race will forever lament... (to Nandor) What is this place known as?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Staten Island.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: The human race will forever lament the night their end was foretold in... Staten Island. Lightning and thunder flash outside. Then a long silent b

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: I’ve been saying we should do something like this for years, Master. Nandor rolls his eyes at how quickly Lazslo has flip-flopped.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: This “Staten Island” -- it is the cultural and political capital of the New World, I trust?

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: WWDITS December 8, 2017 35. (pause) Some say. I mean, there’s an argument to be made...

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: It’s where the boat dropped us off.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: For at least two hundred years I’ve been saying we should relocate to New Amsterdam, but--

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: Enough. Now I must slumber. Wake me when your great work is complete.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Of course. But... um... what kind of time frame are we looking at here?

dialogues.speaker: THE BARON
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: (quietly) My Lord, are you hungry after your trip because we--

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Oh, you mean complete silence.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Shut up, man.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: You said the last thing. And now you made me. Great. With a flash of light and smoke, The Baron lies back in h casket, which closes on its own. And then there is silenc LAZSLO (CONT’D) Well. A lot to unpack here.

dialogues.speaker: NADJA
dialogues.text: Shall we get in the virgins? Hate to let them go to waste.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 36.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: I feel so dumb that I wore glitter. Nandor pulls a velvet sash that rings a bell upstairs. La turns to the Baron’s Familiar.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: I don’t believe we’ve been properly introduced. I’m Lazslo. Very old, very, very good friend of the Baron. The Baron’s Familiar just stares straight ahead, ignoring Lazslo. LAZSLO (CONT’D) Okay. We can catch up after you’ve settled in.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Be honest though, The Baron was kind of a dick.

dialogues.speaker: LAZSLO
dialogues.text: Shh. He’s very powerful.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: You think he heard me?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: I was too late. The two virgins’ eyes are glazed as Colin drones on and o

dialogues.speaker: COLIN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: .-..So in the long run it’s actually cheaper to lease a pre- owned vehicle than to buy one. And if you factor in insurance and maintenance...

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Oh, great! Colin has drained them of all their energy! The perfect end to a perfect evening.  WWDITS December 8, 2017 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guillermo is helping Nandor out of his ornate vestments.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: I’m not sure The Baron understands how big the New World is. I mean, where he’s from, you conquer three villages, you’ve basically conquered the whole country.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Colin got to the virgins. I’ve kept them alive though.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Separately, I assume. Would hate to have them de-virginize each other before we all get a bite.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Of course, Master.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: You’re glum, Guillermo. You think that I’ve forgotten that tonight is a special night for you as well, don’t you? Guillermo brightens bashfully. NANDOR (CONT’D) And does not an anniversary call for a reward recognizing your years of service?

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: I am ready, Master.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Good. Prepare yourself... Guillermo closes his eyes and bares his neck. Not noticin that Nandor has pulled something from his coffin. NANDOR (CONT’D) Okay, open your eyes. Nandor hands Guillermo a hand-made glitter picture of Guillermo and Nandor. Nandor is proud of it. NANDOR (CONT’D) Happy anniversary, Guillermo.  WWDITS USA v23 December 8, 2017 38.

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Oh. Well. Thank you, master.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Savor it. It’s the real reason I wanted all that glitter. Guillermo doesn’t know whether to be touched or insulted. NANDOR (CONT’ D) You deserve it. Two years of

dialogues.speaker: SEEVICE
dialogues.text: ...Twenty years, sir.

dialogues.speaker: NANDOR
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. Close my coffin please. As Guillermo helps Nandor into his coffin...

dialogues.speaker: GUILLERMO
dialogues.text: Slumber soundly, Master. A disappointed Guillermo closes the lid of Nandor’s coffi He tidies the capes on the rack. Takes a moment. Then ang rips the brocade off the cape. GUILLERMO (CONT’D) Frickin brocade...
